front.title: Application Master Session Key (AMSK) for Mobile IPv6

abstract.t: The Extensible Authentication Protocol (EAP) defines an extensible framework for performing network access authentication. Most EAP authentication algorithms, also known as "methods", export keying material that can be used with lower layer ciphersuites. It has been proposed [11] to leverage the EAP keying framework to derive Application Master Session Keys (AMSKs) for specific applications or services. This document defines how to generate Application Master Session Keys (AMSKs) specific to Mobile IPv6. These AMSKs can be used by Mobile Node and Home Agent to bootstrap Mobile IPv6 protocol operation.
